title: Bounding System-Induced Biases in Recommender Systems with A Randomized Dataset. (arXiv:2303.11574v1 [cs.IR])
abstract: Debiased recommendation with a randomized dataset has shown very promising results in mitigating the system-induced biases. However, it still lacks more theoretical insights or an ideal optimization objective function compared with the other more well studied route without a randomized dataset. To bridge this gap, we study the debiasing problem from a new perspective and propose to directly minimize the upper bound of an ideal objective function, which facilitates a better potential solution to the system-induced biases. Firstly, we formulate a new ideal optimization objective function with a randomized dataset. Secondly, according to the prior constraints that an adopted loss function may satisfy, we derive two different upper bounds of the objective function, i.e., a generalization error bound with the triangle inequality and a generalization error bound with the separability. translated_title: 在随机数据集上限制系统诱导偏见的推荐系统
translated_abstract: 在随机数据集上进行去偏差推荐已经显示出很好的效果。但与没有随机数据集的其他更为研究基础的方法相比，它仍缺乏更多的理论洞见或理想的优化目标函数。为填补这一空白，我们从新的角度研究了去偏差问题，并提出直接最小化理想目标函数的上限值，这有利于更好地解决系统诱发的偏差问题。
tldr: 该论文提出一种新的去偏差推荐系统方法，直接最小化理想目标函数上限值，从而更好地解决系统诱发的偏差问题。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes a new debiasing method for recommender systems that directly minimizes the upper bound of an ideal objective function on a randomized dataset, which can better mitigate system-induced biases.
